Package InterfaceUser

Interface PlayerPlay

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AI, PhysicalPlayer, Player

    public interface PlayerPlay
    Lists the functions needed for interactions between the application and the user to play the game. Implemented in the class Player.
    Author:
    Benjamin Héroult
    See Also:
    Player

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int askCard​()
      Asks the player witch card it wants to play among those in hand.
      int askSay​()
      Asks the player if he wants to szy "CARD".
      int askStopAttack​()
      Asks the player if it wants to use his card to stop the attack currently directed toward him.
      void errorScan​(int arg)
      Indicates to the player that the entry is incorrect.
      void falt​()
      Indicates to the player that it made a mistake.
      void getCardsInHand​()
      Indicates the number of cards still in the player's hand.
      void playerTakesCard​()
      Indicates that the player is taking a card from the deck.
      void sayAgainstCard​()
      Makes theplayer say "AGAINST CARD".
      void sayCard​()
      Makes the player say "CARD".
      void seeHand​()
      Indicates the cards still in the player's hand.

    • Method Detail

      • sayCard

        void sayCard​()
        Makes the player say "CARD".

      • sayAgainstCard

        void sayAgainstCard​()
        Makes theplayer say "AGAINST CARD".

      • falt

        void falt​()
        Indicates to the player that it made a mistake.

      • getCardsInHand

        void getCardsInHand​()
        Indicates the number of cards still in the player's hand.

      • seeHand

        void seeHand​()
        Indicates the cards still in the player's hand.

      • errorScan

        void errorScan​(int arg)
        Indicates to the player that the entry is incorrect.
        Parameters:
        arg - the type of error (simple wrong entry as 1 or wrong card played as 2)

      • askCard

        int askCard​()
        Asks the player witch card it wants to play among those in hand.
        Returns:
        the number of the card to play (substract 1 to use it in a card's collection)

      • askSay

        int askSay​()
        Asks the player if he wants to szy "CARD".
        Returns:
        the answer : 0 for no, 1 for yes

      • askStopAttack

        int askStopAttack​()
        Asks the player if it wants to use his card to stop the attack currently directed toward him.
        Returns:
        the answer : 0 for no, 1 for yes

      • playerTakesCard

        void playerTakesCard​()
        Indicates that the player is taking a card from the deck.
